page.title: 02ROAD CONSTRUCTION-CATTERICK
page.content: Catterick with Tunstall lies alongside the A1 motorway and is a through road to the dales and beyond. At one time the major road of England passed right through Catterick but in 1959 a by-pass was built much to the relief of the village folk. Changes had to be made in the village itself. A flyover was built to take traffic travelling from Catterick to Tunstall and beyond. At Manor House, Catterick a flyover was built solely for the use of farm vehicles and animals. The road from Catterick to East Appleton was blocked off and re-routed and resulted in the Weir Bridge being built to staddle the stream running from Tunstall and Brough Park through Catterick and into the Swale. There are four such bridges on this stretch of the stream.
